subject: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Dear Laura,

How are you and your family?

I am writing to you on the directive of Mr. Wilson Ogunleye in the DAM
office.

I was my late *Liu Liao* personal lawyer and I managed his legal affairs
over the period of time he was alive in this country.

My late client died of heart attack because members of his family were
involved in the tsunami disaster in Indonesia and none of his relative is
alive today to claim his project payment on the contract he executed in the
Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation here in Nigeria and with your
cooperation, I can present and file in your name as the due beneficiary and
next of kin to my late client for the release and transfer the fund to you.



 Before my client’s death, he made no will and as such this fund has been
in the bank unclaimed. The bank has contacted me as his lawyer to produce
his next of kin otherwise the fund will be sent to the government treasury
and this I do not want to happen.


It was the late Mrs. Obinaju that provided your contact which she presented
to the NNPC and the intention was to use it hold on for the search of the
next of kin and it was because no name was found to replace you that it now
get to the new management the president contracted to handle the payment of
the debts which is the DAM.



Yes, I tried my possible best and without success to locate any relative of
my late client.

I wish you to stand in as the next of kin and I will use my position to
secure legal documents that will ensure the fund is legally transferred to
you for our mutual benefit. With the legal papers approved in your name, no
one else can come forward to lay claim to this fund.



Presently, I am in possession of all related documents of the contract in
NNPC, and considering the present state of affairs, I will make them
available to you only when you agree to work with us as partners. It was
only mr. Wilson and I are into this transaction with you so please always
keep it confidential. I want this done so that I can use a good part of my
share for helping the poor and the needy and for charity works.

You shall receive 30% for your assistance while Mr. Wilson and I share the
remaining.



I shall require from you, your FULL NAME and CONTACT ADDRESS with TELEPHONE
NUMBERS to start the process of claim in this regard and upon the receipt
of your information i shall go straight to DAM office and file in your
details and already we have a good financial expert in like Mr. Wilson who
will handle the documentation in Dam to ensure the funds is release and
transfer in your name



I assure that the process will be done legally and transparently without
any breach of law.



I wait to hear from you.



Sincerely yours.

Barr. Smith Udumakaihe

Smith Udumak Legal Consultants

Email:  smithudumakaiheesq@gmail.com

Website: http://www.smudumfirm.com

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello Barr. Smith Udumakaihe,

I hope this message finds you well. I'm sorry to hear about the unfortunate circumstances surrounding your late client, Mr. Liu Liao. It's always a tragedy when such disasters strike and lives are lost.

Your proposal is quite intriguing, although I must admit it's a bit overwhelming for me to comprehend fully. Could you please clarify how exactly I fit into this situation? How did Mrs. Obinaju come across my contact information?

Also, could you provide more details about the legal documents that need to be secured in my name? What would be my responsibilities in this process?

Lastly, could you explain more about DAM office and its role in this matter? And who is Mr. Wilson Ogunleye?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Dear Laura,
Your mail was well received, and the contents fully understood.
My client then has high blood pressure which he suffers until his death.
Really, pathetic imagine what it seems when one loses the entire family at
stretch in unfortunate circumstances. Anyway, that has been forgotten.

As I am writing to you already you have been fit in as the next of kin for
the late Mr. Liu. Your contact information is already in the space
designated for the next of kin.

Like I said, I was my late client’s personal lawyer and I managed his legal
affairs over the period of time he was alive and therefore no one will ever
doubt when I confirm you as the next of kin.

Mrs. Louisa Obinaju is now deceased. She died a few years ago. Late woman
has lived most of her life in Europe. Maybe that was where she met you. The
name she is known to us is Mrs. Obinaju. She was the one who presented your
contact to me which, like I stated, is a space holder as I continue
searching for the next of kin and to avoid the government confiscating the
funds into government treasure.

In my capacity, I am giving you a 100% guarantee of the successful
conclusion of this transaction immediately the much needed documents are
secured from the court.

The court automatically will not be involved in illegality; hence you need
not entertain any fears whatsoever. Everything will be carried out within
the ambit of the law, thereby giving you full protection.

I will use your information which I am expecting you to send to me present
at the court to enable them grant you the right as the next of kin to this
fund, which I am certain that we will get the nod of the court to give you
the legal backing as the legally recognized next of kin.

Furthermore, once we get these documents from the court, I shall take it to
the NNPC for authentication before I proceed with it to Dam to release the
inheritance to you into any account nominated by you. I am certain that
they shall be released without hesitation since we have presented the due
requirements.

The only responsibility by you will be to provide the information I require
for the process I want to engage the court for your legal approval as the
next of kin. It is here we require your maximum co-operation.

The Dam is the office the government placed as the authority that is to
process the debt owned by the ministries here for payment to its
beneficiaries.
There were projects which government departments awarded to foreigners and
which were executed and payment sorted for, it was the responsibility of
the Dam when the president through the offices that awarded the project
passed the instruction of the payment the DAM will then process the
payment. And that was what they were doing about this particular
transaction.

Mr. Wilson Oguleye was a member of that management Dam and with him at the
helm of affairs we are assured to achieve our purpose in getting this fund
released to your account. He was drawn from the Central bank where he works
to Dam as one representing the Central Bank in the payment of the debts.
With this tell me how Wilson will give approval of our project and the CBN
will not honour it or the other associated offices.

I shall require from you, your FULL NAME and CONTACT ADDRESS with TELEPHONE
NUMBERS to start the process of claim.

Please don’t fail to let me know if you still require more clarification
from my side.
Regards,
Smith.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello Smith,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I'm sorry to hear about the unfortunate circumstances surrounding Mr. Liu and Mrs. Louisa Obinaju. It's always sad when someone passes away.

I'm a bit confused though, how did Mrs. Obinaju come across my contact information? And why was I chosen as the next of kin? I don't recall ever meeting her or Mr. Liu.

You mentioned that there are some documents that need to be secured from the court, could you please elaborate on what these documents are?

Also, could you explain more about the role of Dam in this process? I'm not familiar with this organization.

Lastly, you mentioned Mr. Wilson Oguleye and his role at Dam and Central Bank. How does he fit into all of this?

I appreciate your patience in answering my questions.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello Smith,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I'm sorry to hear about the loss of Mr. Liu and Mrs. Louisa Obinaju, it must have been a difficult time.

I understand that I've been identified as the next of kin for Mr. Liu, which is quite surprising to me. Could you please explain how this determination was made? 

Also, could you provide more information about the process of securing documents from the court? What kind of documents are we talking about here?

You mentioned NNPC and Dam in your email, but I'm not familiar with these terms. Could you please clarify what they stand for and their role in this process?

Lastly, you mentioned Mr. Wilson Oguleye's role in all this. How exactly is he involved in the process?

I appreciate your patience and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Like I state Laura, you women, if not she is late, would have been at the
right position to explain well to you how she knows you. All his life had
been in Europe and she even died in the UK. But I hope this is not all that
important for now than to commence on how we have the fund received in your
account.



The documents we expected to secure from the court are mainly the approval
by the court in certifying you as the next of kin to my late client. A
certificate of the approval of you as the next of kin will be issued to us
by the court which we are to present to the NNPC and Dam only. Only Dam and
NNPC need the approval because their authentication on the next of kin is
already acceptable by the other departments or offices associated with the
payment.
If the documents are secured from the court, copies of it will be sent to
you for perusal before being submitted to the necessary offices.


DAM is Debt Appropriation Management. It is responsible for file
verification of all payments approved by the president for payment as debt
owed on projects executed in this country. It is the dam that will check if
the claim for any debt by the beneficiary the president presented for
payment is authentic and needs to be paid to that beneficiary. The work
hand in hand with the offices where the project is awarded and executed.
Their approval when given by the dam will be confirmed by the DPVB before
the Finance Ministry will give the allocation of the payment to CBN.



Mr. Wilson's real office is in the Central Bank; he was one of the
directors in the Apex bank before the President brought him to Dam to be
the amount the selected officers by the government to handle all payments
involving projects executed. Therefore, he must have authority in the Dam
and in the Central bank that is what I meant.



The NNPC, Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation was the place the
contract was awarded to my late client. The contract was for the
refurbishing work he did in the oil refinery in Eleme in Rivers State.



I hope your questions are answered.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I'm sorry to hear about Laura's passing, it sounds like she was a very important person.

I'm trying to understand the process better. So, if I understood correctly, the court will certify me as the next of kin and then we present this certification to NNPC and Dam? 

Could you please explain more about what role the Debt Allocation Management Office (DAM) plays in this process? And how does Mr. Wilson's position at Central Bank relate to his work at DAM?

Also, could you tell me more about the contract that was awarded to your late client by NNPC? What kind of work did he do at the oil refinery in Eleme in Rivers State?

I appreciate your patience with my questions. I just want to make sure I fully understand everything.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
On Wed, Feb 14, 2024 at 7:15 PM Laura <wj17399@***.com> wrote:

>
>
>
> Hello there,
>
> Thank you for your detailed explanation. I'm sorry to hear about Laura's
> passing, it sounds like she was a very important person.
>

Mrs. Obinaju was the personal assistant to the late Mr. Liu. It was Mr. Liu
who brought her from abroad to work for him.


I'm trying to understand the process better. So, if I understood correctly,
the court will certify me as the next of kin and then we present this
certification to NNPC and Dam?


The NNPC is required to comply with the court's authorization for the next
of kin to receive the funds on behalf of the late beneficiary. I will then
present the NNPC document  to the DAM office for acknowledgment of the next
of kin's receipt of the funds.


>
> Could you please explain more about what role the Debt Allocation
> Management Office (DAM) plays in this process? And how does Mr. Wilson's
> position at Central Bank relate to his work at DAM?
>

After the court approves the next of kin, the DAM will need certification
from the NNPC. The DAM has the authority to either reject the payment or
approve the release of the funds to the next of kin. They will also be
responsible for preparing and changing the documentation of the payment to
transfer it into your name as the beneficiary before it is sent to the DPVB
and the Ministry of Finance.


>
> Also, could you tell me more about the contract that was awarded to your
> late client by NNPC? What kind of work did he do at the oil refinery in
> Eleme in Rivers State?
>

SUPPLY & COMMISSION 250,000 MONAX TURBINE MINING EQUIPMENT FOR NATURAL
RESOURCES AND COMPUTER OPTIMIZATION IN THE ELEME REFINERY, RIVERS STATE OF
NIGERIA.


>
> I appreciate your patience with my questions. I just want to make sure I
> fully understand everything.
>


I'm sorry, I can't disclose the contract number, until we satisfied you our
partners.

>
> Best wishes,
> Laura
>
>
>
>
>

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello Laura,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's quite a process, isn't it? I'm trying to wrap my head around all of this. So, after the court certifies me as the next of kin, we then present this to NNPC and Dam, correct?

And if I understand correctly, the DAM has the final say in whether or not the funds are released to me? They also handle changing the payment into my name before it's sent to DPVB and Ministry of Finance?

I'm curious about this Monax Turbine Mining Equipment for Natural Resources and Computer in Eleme Refinery. Could you tell me more about that? 

Also, I understand that you can't disclose the contract number yet. But could you perhaps give me an idea of what kind of satisfaction or assurance you need from me as your partner?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
On Thu, Feb 15, 2024 at 12:15 PM Laura <wj17399@***.com> wrote:

>
>
>
> Hello Laura,
>
> Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's quite a process, isn't it?
> I'm trying to wrap my head around all of this. So, after the court
> certifies me as the next of kin, we then present this to NNPC and Dam,
> correct?
>
> And if I understand correctly, the DAM has the final say in whether or not
> the funds are released to me? They also handle changing the payment into my
> name before it's sent to DPVB and Ministry of Finance?
>
> I'm curious about this Monax Turbine Mining Equipment for Natural
> Resources and Computer in Eleme Refinery. Could you tell me more about
> that?
>

This is a technical term for some of the equipment used in the oil
industry, and it is only known by engineers who work in oil companies. I am
just a lawyer, so it is as unfamiliar to me as it is to you.

>
> Also, I understand that you can't disclose the contract number yet. But
> could you perhaps give me an idea of what kind of satisfaction or assurance
> you need from me as your partner?
>

Once you provide the necessary information for us to commence on the
process, meaning you have accepted the offer, then that allows us to open
up other things  with you.

>
> Looking forward to hearing from you.
>
> Best wishes,
> Laura
>
>
>
>
>

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
I wish you to send the information as being expected from you so I can
start the court process immediately. When I receive the copies I will send
you the copies for your perusal.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I understand that you need some documents from me to start the court process. Could you please clarify which specific documents you require? Also, could you explain a bit more about this court process? I'm eager to help but just want to make sure I fully understand what's needed.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello Laura,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. It's fascinating to learn about these technical terms used in the oil industry, even though I'm not an engineer myself.

I understand that providing the necessary details will allow us to proceed further. However, could you please elaborate more on what exactly is required from my end? Also, could you explain a bit more about this process and what it entails?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
What I need is the Account information where the fund will be released,
Name and your telephone contacts.
The court process is like when one is making a declaration or affidavit.
When I receive all the information from you I will write a letter which I
will send to you which is to direct the court, you have granted me the
power to stand as your legal representative and acquire all the necessary
papers for the next of kin on your name.
Please send the required info and as we progress you will understand the
whole process.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your message. I'm really interested in understanding more about this process. Could you please explain a bit more about how the court process works? And what exactly does it mean to stand as my legal and acquire all the necessary papers?

I'm also curious, why do we need an account for the fund release? Is there any other way to handle this without sharing account details?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your message. It sounds like a very interesting process, but I'm not quite sure I understand it all. Could you please explain a bit more about how the court process works? And what exactly does it mean to stand as my legal and acquire all the necessary papers?

I'm also curious about this letter you mentioned. What kind of information will it contain? Will it be something that I need to sign or approve?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
My dear, I have attached those document that will be expected of you to
fill and sign as to answer your question. Frankly, i suppose not send this
papers until I am satisfied you my partner but i was forced to send to you
because you inquisitive.
So please that are the document I expected you fill sign and send to me
that I will take to the court.
One is the legal representative and the application as the next of kin.
Still if you are satisfied you can go ahead and fill them.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you so much for sending over the documents. I appreciate your trust in me and your willingness to share these important papers. 

I'm a bit confused about some parts of the documents though. Could you please clarify what exactly I need to fill out? And also, could you explain a bit more about the legal and next of kin sections?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
The legal process can be complex, especially if you are not physically
present in the country to handle all the court and administrative
procedures yourself. This is why I need a power of attorney from you to
enable me to procure the necessary documents for the next of kin on your
behalf.

If you were in the country, you wouldn't need to grant me the power of
attorney. Instead, I would accompany you to the court to get the legal
documents yourself.
It is important that you issue the legal permission to me so that I can
have your consent to procure all the necessary documents that the
management of Dam and other offices associated with the payment of debt
will require to certify you as the next of kin to the late contractor whose
payment is still pending, which I am yet to provide the legal papers to
prove the next of kin.

Filling out the next of kin form might be confusing to you, and there are
certain sections that I should complete or provide you with the necessary
information to fill in. You should focus on the sections that pertain to
you, and I will assist you with the rest of the form.

If you are ready to start filling out the form, begin with the sections
that concern you, and I will provide you with the additional information
needed for the subsequent pages.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for explaining the process to me. I must admit, it does sound a bit complicated. I'm not very familiar with legal procedures and such, so your guidance is much appreciated.

Just to clarify, this power of attorney would allow you to handle all the necessary paperwork on my behalf, correct? And once that's done, I would be recognized as the next of kin?

I'm also curious about this form you mentioned. Could you tell me more about what kind of information it requires? You mentioned some sections pertain specifically to me - could you elaborate on that?

Again, thank you for your patience and assistance in this matter. It's all a bit overwhelming but I'm sure we'll get through it together!

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Laura,

Yes, the power of attorney from you will allow me to handle the paperwork
that will confirm you as the next of kin.
The form I sent to you is from the court, and if filled out, I shall
present it to the court with the power of attorney and your ID.

The information you asked about the next of kin is in the form I sent to
you. Please check the attachment, as I have separated the sections for your
understanding.
I will take care of the sections for the deceased and the attorney, or will
fill out the deceased section with you by providing the necessary
information required on the form.

I apologize for the delay in writing to you. I have been quite busy in the
courtroom and will be going out any moment to meet an appointment.


I look forward to hearing from you.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Please let me know when you want to fill the form so I can send you the
corrent form from the High court. The one you have now is the old form I
found in my file.
I collected the newest form yesterday.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the time you've taken to explain everything to me. I'm not very familiar with legal matters, so your guidance is really helpful.

I have looked over the form you sent and I think I understand most of it. However, could you please clarify what exactly "next of kin" means in this context? Also, what kind of information will be required from me for the deceased section?

I hope my questions aren't too bothersome. As I mentioned before, this is all new territory for me.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your message. I appreciate your help in this matter. Could you please tell me more about the differences between the old form and the new one? Also, what is the process of filling out this new form? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Next of kin means closest living relatives or legal relationships.

It is exactly the idea of placing you as the late Liu’s next of kin, and
the fund will be processed and paid to you accordingly. Be rest assured
that we are fully capable of making this work, and I am 100% confident that
we will be successful.

I have been the late Mr. Liu's personal legal representative and for the
past 17 years, during this time, I have diligently searched for any
relatives or legal connections to him who will come and receive his
proceeds from the NNPC, without success. My close relationship with the
late Mr. Liu is well-known to the NNPC management and other institutions,
and I will secure all the necessary legal documents to ensure the smooth
and legal transfer of the funds to you, for our mutual benefit.

Once the legal papers are approved in your name as the next of kin, the
request for the fund to be paid to you will be granted and endorsed by the
relevant offices. I am very confident about this process.

As part of our plan, once the claim is successful, we will ensure that any
traces of the claim linking to you are destroyed, in the unlikely event of
any future suspicions or issues, which I don’t think can happen.

I will provide you with all the necessary information about the deceased
that you will need to fill in the form regarding the late Mr. Liu.

Please I want you to declare the interest and send now what was demanded
from you and I send you the form you are to fill. The only difference is
that the new form produced by the court is more elaborate than the older
one.

Smith

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello Smith,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's quite an interesting proposition, I must say. However, I'm a bit confused about some parts of the process. Could you please clarify what exactly it means to be placed as the late Mr. Liu's next of kin? 

Also, could you explain more about how the fund will be processed and paid to me? What are the steps involved in this process?

You mentioned that all traces of the claim linking to me will be destroyed once the claim is successful. How exactly will this be done?

Lastly, you mentioned a form that needs to be filled out regarding the late Mr. Liu. Could you provide more details about this form? What kind of information does it require?

I appreciate your patience in answering my questions.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
On Sat, Feb 17, 2024 at 11:15 AM Laura <wj17399@***.com> wrote:

>
>
>
> Hello Smith,
>
> Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's quite an interesting
> proposition, I must say. However, I'm a bit confused about some parts of
> the process. Could you please clarify what exactly it means to be placed as
> the late Mr. Liu's next of kin?
>

To front you as the next of kin or to act as the next of kin to Mr. Liu.


>
> Also, could you explain more about how the fund will be processed and paid
> to me? What are the steps involved in this process?
>


We have mentioned this several times: the Dam office will initiate the
process by obtaining court approval for the next of kin, then proceed to
NNPC for certification, and finally continue the process at Dam in the name
of the next of kin.


>
> You mentioned that all traces of the claim linking to me will be destroyed
> once the claim is successful. How exactly will this be done?
>

I will handle my part, starting from the court registrar's office, while
Mr. Wilson will take care of the Dam office and other related offices.


>
> Lastly, you mentioned a form that needs to be filled out regarding the
> late Mr. Liu. Could you provide more details about this form? What kind of
> information does it require?
>

The information is the same as what you already have, but it has been
presented in a new form with more detailed sections. You will see the form
when it is sent to you, as it contains the same information.


>
> I appreciate your patience in answering my questions.
>
> Best wishes,
> Laura
>
>
>
>
>

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello Laura,

Thank you for your email. It's quite an interesting proposition you've presented here. I'm curious about a few things though, if you don't mind me asking.

Firstly, could you please elaborate on the role of Mr. Liu in this process? And how exactly am I supposed to act as his next of kin?

Secondly, what is the significance of obtaining court approval and proceeding to NNPC and Dam? Could you explain these steps in more detail?

Lastly, regarding the form that will be sent to me, could you give me a brief overview of what it contains before I receive it?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Please, I can answer your further questions if you let me know your
interest. I have just spoken with Mr. Wilson about this and we have decided
to release more information until we know your decision.
Some of the questions you now ask are unnecessary because it has been
explained severally.
Regards.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your response. I'm really interested in knowing more about this. Could you please elaborate on what Mr. Wilson and you have decided? Also, could you clarify the points that have been explained severally? I'm sorry if I missed out on any details earlier.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your response. I'm really interested in knowing more about this. Could you please elaborate on what Mr. Wilson has decided to release? Also, I apologize if my questions seem repetitive, but could you kindly clarify the points that have been explained severally? I just want to make sure I fully understand everything.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Yes, you can bear with me. We have been discussing this question for over a
week now, and no tangible decision has been made. We would like to have
your decision pronounced before we make any further decisions. We don't
want it to be exposed to many people that we are waiting patiently for, but
it seems like you haven't made up your mind yet. We cannot continue
delaying the process, as the Dam is in the 1st batch of the payment before
they enter into the 2nd batch.

The explanation of the role of the death contractor and how you are
supposed to be the next of kin is not relevant, along with other questions.

The information about me, Wilson, the court, NNPC, Dam, Dpvb, Ministry of
Finance, and the Central Bank has been broken down for your understanding.
Still, more of what was explained to you is being repeated.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your message. I understand that the decision-making process has been taking longer than expected and I apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. 

I'm a bit confused about some of the details you've mentioned, though. Could you please clarify what exactly is the role of the death contractor? And how am I supposed to be the next of kin? 

Also, could you explain more about Wilson, NNPC, Dam, Dpvb, Ministry of Finance, and the Central Bank? I'm sorry if these questions seem repetitive but I just want to make sure that I fully understand everything.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Please can you send the required information if you are interested, we need
to start the process.
waiting.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for reaching out. I'm eager to help, but could you please clarify what exactly is required? What process are we starting? I'm looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Your full name,account details and ID.
The id could be a copy of an international passport or id that shows your
face.
It was what needed to approach the court for the next of kin.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Oh, hello there! I'm really excited to help out with this. However, I'm a bit confused about the process. Could you explain it to me in simpler terms? What exactly does "next of kin" mean? And why do we need to approach the court for it?

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Dear Laura,
I am anticipating having the information from you to commence the process
from the court.
Waiting to have them.
Regards,
Smith.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello Laura,

I hope this message finds you well. I'm excited to hear more about the process from the court that you mentioned in your previous communication. Could you please provide me with more details? What are the next steps we need to take?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
I have been so busy for two days on a case I had in the high court
involving a client that was why I haven't responded to your message.
The step now is going to the court to get the order that will confirm you
as the next of kin and allow us to present you as the one who will inherit
the fund of Mr. Liu.
Please endeavour to send the information to allow me to approach the court
tomorrow.

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Wow, that sounds like a lot of work! I can't even begin to imagine how busy you must be dealing with such important matters. It's really fascinating to hear about your job in the high court.

I'm curious though, how does one go about confirming someone as the next of kin? Is it a complicated process? And what happens after I'm presented as the one who will inherit Mr. Liu's fund?

Looking forward to hearing more about this intriguing situation!

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: about the project In DAM, Smith Udumakaihe Esq.
body:
Hello there,

Wow, that sounds like a lot of work! I can't even begin to imagine how busy you must be dealing with such important matters. It's really fascinating to hear about your job in the high court.

I'm curious though, could you explain a bit more about this process? How does one get confirmed as the next of kin in court? And what exactly does it mean to present someone as the one who will inherit the fund?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Laura
